articles.headline: Arbitrators Ease Blame on Ernst & Young for Audits of Lehman Brothers
articles.snippet: A ruling by a panel of former judges found that Lehman Brothers management, not Ernst & Young, was most responsible for setting in motion a maneuver that let Lehman move billions off its balance sheet.
articles.abstract: A ruling by a panel of former judges found that Lehman Brothers management, not Ernst & Young, was most responsible for setting in motion a maneuver that let Lehman move billions off its balance sheet.
articles.lead_paragraph: The finger-pointing over who was responsible for the collapse of Lehman Brothers continues nearly six years after the firm filed for bankruptcy at the height of the financial crisis.

articles.headline: Publishers Turn to the Crowd to Find the Next Best Seller
articles.snippet: Publishers are increasingly tapping the collective wisdom of the crowd to help them in the hunt for literary treasures on the web.
articles.abstract: Publishers are increasingly tapping the collective wisdom of the crowd to help them in the hunt for literary treasures on the web.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sandy Hall was nervous. Ms. Hall, a librarian in Morristown, N.J., was preparing one recent night to lead her weekly book club meeting with a group of 14 teenagers. The book being discussed, a young-adult romance titled “A Little Something Different,” was her own debut novel.

articles.headline: Now Arriving at Pittsburgh International: Fracking
articles.snippet: The airport’s runways are sitting on enough natural gas to run the whole state of Pennsylvania for a year and a half.
articles.abstract: The airport’s runways are sitting on enough natural gas to run the whole state of Pennsylvania for a year and a half.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — Where 600 flights used to take off and land every day here at Pittsburgh International Airport, there are now about 300. Partway down Terminal B, the moving sidewalk that used to lead to a dozen gates now stops abruptly at a plain gray wall.

articles.headline: New York Prosecutors Charge Payday Loan Firms With Usury
articles.snippet: New York prosecutors brought criminal charges against a dozen payday loan companies and their founder, Carey Vaughn Brown, accusing them of flouting the state’s limits on interest rates on loans.
articles.abstract: New York prosecutors brought criminal charges against a dozen payday loan companies and their founder, Carey Vaughn Brown, accusing them of flouting the state’s limits on interest rates on loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: A trail of money that began with triple-digit loans to troubled New Yorkers and wound through companies owned by a former used-car salesman in Tennessee led New York prosecutors on a yearlong hunt through the shadowy world of payday lending.

articles.headline: ‘Beep,’ Says the Bellhop
articles.snippet: The Aloft hotel in Cupertino, Calif., will begin testing a robot designed to shuttle items from the hotel lobby desk to guest rooms.
articles.abstract: The Aloft hotel in Cupertino, Calif., will begin testing a robot designed to shuttle items from the hotel lobby desk to guest rooms.
articles.lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif. — Think of it as the Terminator’s human-friendly sibling.

articles.headline: At Heart of Ebola Outbreak, a Village Frozen by Fear and Death
articles.snippet: More than 60 people have died from the virus in a tiny village in Sierra Leone, and now people there worry that a quarantine will cut off their food and supplies.
articles.abstract: More than 60 people have died from the virus in a tiny village in Sierra Leone, and now people there worry that a quarantine will cut off their food and supplies.
articles.lead_paragraph: NJALA NGIEMA, Sierra Leone — The signs of a deadly struggle remain: Scattered around the houses of the Ebola dead lie empty pill packages, their plastic casings punched through. Nearby in the mud are used packets of oral rehydration salts. The pills did not work, and the hurried trip to the hospital, if there was one, came too late.

articles.headline: Opting Against Ebola Drug for Ill African Doctor
articles.snippet: International colleagues of the doctor who had been leading Sierra Leone’s battle against the outbreak had to decide whether to give him a drug never before tested on people.
articles.abstract: International colleagues of the doctor who had been leading Sierra Leone’s battle against the outbreak had to decide whether to give him a drug never before tested on people.
articles.lead_paragraph: The doctor who had been leading Sierra Leone’s battle against the Ebola outbreak was now fighting for his own life, and his international colleagues faced a fateful decision: whether to give him a drug that had never before been tested on people.

articles.headline: China Puts Pressure on Foreign Carmakers
articles.snippet: Audi was recently a target in an antitrust investigation by Beijing, which is examining prices for replacement parts.
articles.abstract: Audi was recently a target in an antitrust investigation by Beijing, which is examining prices for replacement parts.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — General Motors said on Tuesday that it had been contacted by the Chinese authorities as part of a broadening antitrust investigation into foreign automakers. One day earlier, Audi said that in one province, the dealership network of its Chinese joint venture had broken national antitrust rules and would be punished by the government.

articles.headline: Maliki’s Bid to Keep Power in Iraq Seems to Collapse
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s defiant fight to retain power in Iraq appeared to collapse after his former backers in Iran, the military and his own party all signaled that he could no longer expect their support.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s defiant fight to retain power in Iraq appeared to collapse after his former backers in Iran, the military and his own party all signaled that he could no longer expect their support.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s defiant fight to retain power in Iraq appeared to collapse on Tuesday after his former backers in Iran, the military and his own party all signaled that he could no longer expect their support.

articles.headline: Shooting Spurs Hashtag Effort on Stereotypes
articles.snippet: The police shooting of Michael Brown, a Missouri teenager, has prompted a social media campaign over negative depictions of young black men in the news media.
articles.abstract: The police shooting of Michael Brown, a Missouri teenager, has prompted a social media campaign over negative depictions of young black men in the news media.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Tyler Atkins heard about the fatal shooting of Michael Brown, 18, an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo., he posted on Twitter a picture of himself in a tuxedo, with a saxophone around his neck, next to a photograph of himself dressed in a black T-shirt with a blue bandanna tied around his head and his finger pointed at the camera.
